question:
On a recent holiday you lost avaluable item. Fortunately, you have travel insurance to cover the cost of anything lost.
Write a letter to the manager of your insurance company. In your letter:
-describe the item you lost
-explain how you lost it
-tell the insurance company what you would like them to do.
text: My name is Raghu and I am your travel insurance policyholder with Identification number #23451, writing this letter to claim  insurance for the expensive jewellery lost during my travel.
My precious beautiful pendant necklace is made up of 24 carats of gold, a chain of length 18cms, weighing around 25grams, and a locket made up of green gemstone.

I lost my precious necklace when I was enjoying my vacation on Cuba beaches the last Sunday.To provide more background, I was returning from an island in a steamboat, accidentally, a co-passenger bumped into me due to which I lost my balance and fell into the water. That is the moment my ornament fell into the deep water.

As per the coverage, I am entitled to reimburse for the item lost so would like to claim the equivalent amount for the item from your company, I am aware that post reimbursement my monthly premiums will rise.
I hope you clear the claim and dispatch the money.
